availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Son of John Halbrook and Elizabeth Halbrook. Married to Amanda Halbrook. Father of George Halbrook and Nancy E. Halbrook. Laborer in Graves County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Graves County in 1860. Farmer in Graves County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, District 2, p. 370A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 45.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, Mayfield, p. 196B.
"Mayfield News," The Paducah Evening Sun (Paducah, Kentucky), March 30, 11910, p. 4.
KYR-0001-029-0170
